decks.notes: The main concept of the deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures, then use various spells to reanimate or bring them back to the battlefield in order to execute a game-winning combo. Cards like Reanimate, Balustrade Spy, and Undercity Informer are used to expedite this process, while cards like Thassa's Oracle and Bridge from Below provide alternative win conditions. The deck relies heavily on mana acceleration through cards like Chrome Mox and Simian Spirit Guide to enable explosive plays and outmaneuver opponents in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly and efficiently reanimate powerful creatures from the graveyard, such as Griselbrand and Archon of Cruelty, using cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead. The deck also includes cards like Entomb and Faithless Looting to fill the graveyard with creatures and spells to be reanimated. Additionally, cards like Cabal Therapy and Thoughtseize provide disruption for the opponent's strategy while also enabling the reanimation combo. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and combo potential.

The main concept of this Canadian Threshold deck in Legacy 1 vs 1 format is to be aggressive and controlling at the same time. The deck utilizes efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler to pressure the opponent while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Force of Will and Daze. The deck aims to maintain tempo by using cards like Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base and quickly close out games with cards like Murktide Regent and Lightning Bolt. The deck also utilizes cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder to find the right cards at the right time.

The main concept of this Dredge combo deck is to quickly fill your graveyard with cards like Stinkweed Imp and Golgari Grave-Troll, allowing you to use cards like Bridge from Below and Ichorid to create an overwhelming board presence. Utilize cards like Cabal Therapy and Faithless Looting to disrupt your opponent's strategy while also digging for key combo pieces. Once you have set up your graveyard, use cards like Lion's Eye Diamond to generate mana and bring back powerful creatures like Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis. This deck aims to quickly overwhelm your opponent with a fast and relentless graveyard strategy.

This deck focuses on using control elements like Stifle, Force of Will, and Swords to Plowshares to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also utilizes cards like Dress Down and Consign to Memory to deal with threats and generate card advantage. The key concept is to efficiently control the game through countering spells, removing threats, and disrupting the opponent's strategy, while also maintaining card advantage and board presence with cards like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. The deck's win condition revolves around playing Phyrexian Dreadnought and using it in combination with Curie, Emergent Intelligence and Abhorrent Oculus to close out the game.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Troll of Khazad-d√ªm and Archon of Cruelty using cards like Entomb and Thoughtseize. It then uses reanimation spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead to cheat these creatures into play early and overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Daze to protect its combo pieces, as well as Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base. The goal is to assemble the combo quickly and efficiently to win the game before the opponent can respond effectively.

This deck focuses on tempo advantage and disruption, utilizing cheap counterspells and removal spells to control the board while deploying threats like Delver of Secrets, Murktide Regent, and Brazen Borrower to apply pressure. The deck aims to quickly establish an aggressive board presence while disrupting the opponent's game plan, constantly staying ahead in the race to victory through a mix of efficient spells and powerful creatures. The mana base is streamlined to support the deck's aggressive strategy, providing a solid foundation for casting spells while also maximizing resource denial with Wasteland.

The deck focuses on quickly dropping disruptive red permanents like Chalice of the Void, Blood Moon, and Magus of the Moon to shut down the opponent's game plan. It also aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful aggro creatures like Broadside Bombardiers and Pyrogoyf. The deck can also burn the opponent out of the game with cards like Fury and Sundering Eruption. The goal is to lock down the opponent's mana base and disrupt their strategy while beating them down with efficient threats.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble the Painter's Servant and Grindstone combo, allowing you to mill your opponent's entire deck in one turn. This combo is supported by cards like Goblin Engineer and Goblin Welder to find and recur key pieces. The deck also includes disruption elements like Red Elemental Blast and Pyroblast to protect your combo and disrupt your opponent's strategy. Additionally, the deck runs mana acceleration through cards like Lotus Petal and Ancient Tomb to quickly establish your board presence and execute the combo.

The main focus of this deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent by playing efficient threats such as Delver of Secrets, Murktide Regent, and Dragon's Rage Channeler. It aims to control the board using counterspells like Force of Will and Daze, while also disrupting the opponent's mana base with Wasteland. The deck also has card advantage engines in the form of Mishra's Bauble and Ponder, allowing it to maintain pressure and close out games quickly. It leverages a mix of aggressive creatures and versatile spells to maintain tempo and outpace the opponent.

The key idea of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Grim Monolith and Ancient Tomb, allowing you to play powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Glaring Fleshraker ahead of schedule. Cards like Chalice of the Void and Kozilek's Command help disrupt your opponent's game plan while Sowing Mycospawn provides additional value and board presence. With strong mana acceleration and disruptive elements, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with early aggression and powerful threats to secure victory in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The deck focuses on using fast mana acceleration and rituals to quickly generate a large amount of mana in order to cast powerful spells like Tendrils of Agony and Empty the Warrens. The goal is to combo off and win the game in one explosive turn, utilizing cards such as Lion's Eye Diamond and Goblin Charbelcher to deal massive amounts of damage. The deck also includes disruption like Thoughtseize and Veil of Summer to protect the combo. Gaea's Will and Echo of Eons provide additional ways to reload the hand and keep the combo going.
